body:
Problem: using win_viewport for implementing smooth scrolling in an external UI might run into problems when winbar is used, as there is no indication that the entire grid is not used for scrolled buffer text.

Solution: add win_viewport_margins event. reserve possibility for margins in every direction, even though currently only top is used for winbar.

Addresses a part of #23610, in particular https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/23610#issuecomment-1868216660

comment_regular_data.body: This seems like a good step. Could it also be extended to specify margins when floating window borders are used or should that be done in a subsequent PR?
yes, it should. will add it here.
Awesome. Let me look into making a local build and integrating it in neovide just to double check this works how I think it does.

I struggled to get everything building from source on my windows machine. On inspection though I think that this PR will solve the gui smooth scrolling portion of #23610 though so don't block on me. Once this merges I will test it via the nightly build
@akiyosi yes using a floating window with both borders and winbar

One gotcha that wasn't obvious at first is that the viewport margins are sometimes sent before the window position has been reported to the gui. @bfredl Imho this was somewhat unexpected and should be represented in the documentation or delayed until the window is positioned/sized.

@akiyosi keep this in mind for your implementation

Are they both sent on the same batch before "flush" or does this happen with events in separate batches?

The idea is that window state is fully self consistent at points where "flush" is sent. As long as that is maintained, I don't see one order being more natural than the other.
I believe they are. Makes sense!

> Are they both sent on the same batch before "flush" or does this happen with events in separate batches?
> 
> The idea is that window state is fully self consistent at points where "flush" is sent. As long as that is maintained, I don't see one order being more natural than the other.

Ok looks like the initial ViewportMargin events are not sent in the same batch as the resize or position events which are used to initialize the window. This isn't a huge deal since the initial events are all empty, but is still unexpected
Number column width should probably be in `grid_line` instead, because virtual lines with `virt_lines_leftcol` do not have number column.

title: feature(ui): indicate margins for the area used by win_viewport
